title: What are the criticisms of positivism? - Quora

response.answer_text: One criticism is that the verification principle is itself not subject to verification. The verification principle asserts that any meaningful statement consists of logical connectives and sense data, or simply logic (tautology). E. G. “John is eating.” John is the subject, his existence can be verified, and he is eating,which also can be verified. The logical connective is “a is in state b.” This is the state of John eating. The sentence, “the only meaningful propositions are those that are logically true or those that can be verified by sense experience,” is itself empirically unverifiable.

One criticism of positivism is that its initial presuppositions are arbitrary. They are not derived from logic or experience or a general consensus of all philosophers or scientists. They are just naked presuppositions. No harm in that but they have the logical foundation equal to. “Wouldn’t it be cool if “…….” ?
